snippet: Although global demand for solar panels and wind turbines has grown rapidly in recent years, China’s manufacturing capacity grew faster, creating an oversupply and a price war.
abstract: China's manufacturing of solar panels and wind turbines has grown faster than global demand, creating an oversupply and a price war; result is looming financial disaster for both manufacturers and state-owned banks that financed factories with nearly $18 billion in low-rate loans and for municipal and provincial governments that provided loan guarantees.
lead_paragraph: Although global demand for solar panels and wind turbines has grown rapidly in recent years, China’s manufacturing capacity grew faster, creating an oversupply and a price war.

headline.seo: Glut of Solar Panels Is a New Test for China
headline.main: Glut of Solar Panels Poses a New Threat to China
headline.print_headline: Strategy of Solar Dominance Now Poses a Threat to China
